required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: UAB 0718 - Phase II Trial to Assess Target Oral Therapy as Adjuvant Chemoprevention in High-Risk Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Trial to Assess Target Oral Therapy as Adjuvant Chemoprevention in High-Risk Head and Neck Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether erlotinib will be effective in controlling cancer that has returned after treatment with salvage surgery and radiation. This study will also determine what effects, good and/or bad, this drug has on the participants.

detailed_description.textblock: An investigator-initiated Phase II clinical trial of the safety and tolerability of erlotinib as an adjuvant therapy after definitive therapy via salvage surgery in head and neck cancer patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Demonstrating the Safety and Tolerability of Long Term Erlotinib Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who had the most frequently observed undesirable effects after exposure to study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Disease Free Status at 12 Months and 24 Months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who were disease free at 12 months (12 months after initiation of study drug treatment) and 24 months (12 months after completion of study drug treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Demonstrating Survival at 12 Months and 24 Months.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who were still alive at 12 months following completion of study drug therapy and at 24 months following completion of study drug therapy

arm_group.description: All patients will be prescribed erlotinib 150mg daily

intervention.description: 150 mg per day by mouth for 12 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Pathologically confirmed diagnosis of recurrent or second primary squamous cell carcinoma
2. Recurrence or second primary of the oral cavity, oropharynx, hypopharynx, or larynx. Recurrent neck metastasis with unknown primary is allowed
3. Prior radiation therapy for head and neck cancer
4. Disease must be considered surgically resectable or candidate for curative reirradiation
5. Adequate diagnostic workup
6. Zubrod Performance Status 0-2
7. Life expectancy 12 weeks
8. Age 19, 9. Adequate laboratory data.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior invasive cancers other than head and neck cancer unless disease free for a minimum of 3 years. (Prior non-melanomatous skin cancer and previous carcinoma in situ are permissible)
2. Patients who are pregnant or lactating
3. Psychological condition that renders the patient unable to understand the informed consent
4. Any situation or condition that will interfere with adherence to study activities.

clinical_study.keyword: Resectable, recurrent head and neck cancer

group.title: Tarceva
group.description: All patients will be prescribed Tarceva 150mg daily Erlotinib: 150 mg per day by mouth for 12 months

group.title: Tarceva
group.description: All patients will be prescribed Tarceva 150mg daily Erlotinib: 150 mg per day by mouth for 12 months

measure.title: ECOG performance status
measure.description: ECOG PS 0 Fully active,able to carry on all predisease performance without restriction Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory & able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work Ambulatory & capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up & about more than 50% of waking hours Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair Dead The ECOG PS is in the public domain.

measure.title: Tumor Stage at Study Start - Primary Tumor Stage (T)
measure.description: Classification of Malignant Tumors based on the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging criteria. T indicates tumor size, extent, or penetration (depth) of the tumor. T1 is the smallest/least advanced,while T4 is the largest/most advanced.

measure.title: Tumor Stage at Study Start - Regional Metastasis (N)
measure.description: Classification of Malignant Tumors based on the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging criteria. N indicates the number of lymph nodes with cancer or the location of the cancer-involved lymph nodes. N0 = no regional lymph node metastasis N1 = a single ipsilateral lymph node <3 cm in greatest dimension N2 = a single ipsilateral lymph nodes 3-6 cm in size OR multiple ipsilateral, bilateral, or contralateral lymph nodes <6 cm in greatest dimension N3 = a lymph node >6 cm in greatest dimension

measure.title: Procedure details
measure.description: Number of participants who received coincident placement of tracheostomy or PEG tube during salvage surgery prior to enrollment

measure.title: Flap reconstruction
measure.description: Number of participants who received flap reconstruction during salvage surgery prior to enrollment

measure.title: Neck dissection
measure.description: Number of participants who received a neck dissection (either unilateral or bilateral) during salvage surgery prior to enrollment

event.description: Pt had cardiac stents placed; event deemed unrelated to protocol therapy
Pt hospitalized for MI felt possibly related to study drug
Pt hospitalized for nausea and vomiting felt related to inadequate PEG and H pylori infection
Pt hospitalized and diagnosed with Bell's Palsy
Pt hospitalized for respiratory failure and pneumonia felt releated to disease recurrence
Pt hospitalized for stridor and trach debulking, felt unrelated to study drug
Pt hospitalized for septic shock and ARDS related to pneumonia; unrelated to study drug
Pt hospitalized for throat bleeding felt related to disease progress

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
